Catat! Parkir Liar di Trotoar Bisa Kena Denda Maksimal Rp 250 Ribu
02 Nov 2019, 18:58 by Matius Alfons
Jakarta - Polisi bakal menertibkan kendaraan-kendaraan yang diparkir di kawasan Fatmawati, Jakarta Selatan. Pengendara yang memarkir kendaraannya di atas trotoar bisa dikenai denda maksimal Rp 250 ribu.
"Bisa, tilang itu ada dalam Pasal 275 ayat 1 UU No 22 Tahun 2009 tentang Lalu Lintas dan Angkutan Jalan (LLAJ)," kata Kasubdit Gakkum Ditlantas Polda Metro Jaya Kompol Fahri Siregar saat dihubungi, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
Adapun, Pasal 275 ayat (1) berbunyi:

Setiap orang yang melakukan perbuatan yang mengakibatkan gangguan pada fungsi rambu lalu lintas, marka jalan, alat pemberi isyarat lalu lintas, fasilitas pejalan kaki dan alat pengaman pengguna jalan sebagaimana dimaksud dalam Pasal 28 ayat (2) dipidana dengan pidana kurungan paling lama satu bulan atau denda paling banyak Rp 250 ribu.

Fahri menjelaskan yang dimaksud dengan gangguan fasilitas pejalan kaki dalam pasal tersebut salah satunya adalah parkir liar di trotoar.
"Intinya bahwa bagi setiap orang yang akibatkan gangguan pada fasilitas pejalan kaki, salah satunya trotoar, dapat diancam pidana kurungan 1 bulan atau denda Rp 250 ribu," ucap Fahri.

Note it! Illegal Parking on the Pavement Can Get a Maximum Penalty of Rp. 250 Thousand
02 Nov 2019, 18:58 by Matthew Alfons
Jakarta - Police will curb vehicles parked in the Fatmawati area, South Jakarta. Drivers who park their vehicles on the sidewalk can be fined a maximum of Rp. 250 thousand.
"Yes, the ticket is in Article 275 paragraph 1 of Law No. 22 Year 2009 concerning Road Traffic and Transportation (LLAJ)," Kasubdit Gakkum, Director of Metro Jaya Regional Police, Kompol Fahri Siregar said when contacted on Saturday (11/02/2019).
Meanwhile, Article 275 paragraph (1) reads:

Any person who commits an act that causes disturbance to the function of traffic signs, road markings, traffic signal devices, pedestrian facilities and road user safety equipment as referred to in Article 28 paragraph (2) shall be liable to a maximum imprisonment of one month or a fine Rp 250 thousand at the most.

Fahri explained what was meant by interference with pedestrian facilities in the article one of which was illegal parking on the sidewalk.
"The point is that for anyone who causes interference with pedestrian facilities, one of which is the sidewalk, can be threatened with one month imprisonment or a fine of Rp. 250 thousand," Fahri said.
